citation.biblCit: Population Research Laboratory, 2015, "Alberta Survey, 2014B", https://doi.org/10.7939/DVN/10575, UAL Dataverse, V3

AuthEnty.affiliation: Department of Sociology, University of Alberta

stdyInfo.abstract: The Population Research Laboratory (PRL) administered the 2014 Alberta Survey B. This survey of households across the province of Alberta continues to enable academic researchers, government departments, and non-profit organizations to explore a wide range of topics in a structured research framework and environment. Sponsorsâ€™ research questions are asked together with demographic questions in a telephone interview of Alberta households.

sumDscr.universe: The main feature of the sampling design was a two-stage selection process: first, based on a selection of households, and second, the selection of a respondent within each household. The Alberta Survey B aimed for a total sample size of 1,200 households across Alberta, with a minimum of 400 respondents in Metropolitan Edm onton, 400 in Metropolitan Calgary, and 400 from the remainder of the province (other Alberta). The target population are persons 18 years of age or older who, at the time of the survey, are living in a dwelling unit that could be contacted by direct dialing.

var.labl: Respondent Number for identification

var.labl: Quota Distribution

var.labl: Gender of respondent

var.name: a1
var.labl: Introduction read to only half of respondents [ssel=1]

var.name: a1a
var.labl: Agreement level with the GoA putting in place minimum energy efficiency levels for: Building materials, such as windows and doors?

var.name: a1b
var.labl: Agreement level with the GoA putting in place minimum energy efficiency levels for: The operation of industrial facilities?

var.name: a2
var.labl: In general, do you think that politicians care what people like you think?

var.name: a3
var.labl: How much can people like you affect what the government does?

var.name: a4
var.labl: How much do you trust the provincial government to make good decisions about energy efficiency?

var.name: a5
var.labl: Generally speaking, how much trust do you have in the Government of Alberta?

var.name: a6
var.labl: How much influence should this type (Government hosted public engagement initiatives) of citizen group have on government decisions?

var.name: b1
var.labl: How many times in your life have you felt bereavement grief?

var.name: b2
var.labl: How long ago did the death, that you last grieved over or are grieving now, happen? [years]

catgry.labl: NA - Answer to B1 is zero

var.name: b2a
var.labl: How long ago did the death, that you last grieved over or are grieving now, happen? [months]

catgry.labl: NA or Answer to B1 is zero

var.name: b3
var.labl: How much bereavement grief do you feel right now - on a scale from 0 to 10?

catgry.labl: NA - Answer to B1 is zero

var.name: b4
var.labl: Who was the one that died - the one that you last grieved over or are grieving over now?

catgry.labl: An animal such as a family pet or another living creature such as a horse
NA - Answer to B1 is zero

var.name: b5
var.labl: How would you rate the quality of the death and dying process for the one who died - on a scale from 0 to 10?

catgry.labl: NA - Answer to B1 is zero

var.name: b6
var.labl: Have you ever in your lifetime sought and obtained help for your bereavement grief...?

catgry.labl: No - there was nothing available or desirable
No - but I did go to a medical doctor to talk about my feelings or for help with grief
Yes - but it was not helpful
NA - Answer to B1 is zero

var.name: c1
var.labl: To the best of your knowledge what is the leading cause of death for Albertans under the age of 45?

var.name: c2
var.labl: Thinking about the different health problems facing Albertans today, how serious a health problem do you consider injuries to be?

var.name: c3
var.labl: Which of the following sentences do you most agree with? Injuries are...

var.name: c4
var.labl: Using a 5-point scale, where 1 means 'not at all preventable', and 5 means 'entirely preventable', how preventable do you think the following injuries are: Poisonings?

var.name: c5
var.labl: Using a 5-point scale, where 1 means 'not at all preventable', and 5 means 'entirely preventable', how preventable do you think the following injuries are: Drowning?

var.name: c6
var.labl: Using a 5-point scale, where 1 means 'not at all preventable', and 5 means 'entirely preventable', how preventable do you think the following injuries are: Head injuries from not wearing a helmet while bicycle riding?

var.name: c7
var.labl: Using a 5-point scale, where 1 means 'not at all preventable', and 5 means 'entirely preventable', how preventable do you think the following injuries are: Suicides?

var.name: c8
var.labl: Thinking about the different health issues, for example, motor vehicle collisions, falls, violence, facing Albertans today, how serious do you consider poisonings to be?

var.name: c9
var.labl: Thinking about the different health issues, for example, motor vehicle collisions, falls, violence, facing Albertans today, how serious do you consider suicide to be?

var.name: d13
var.labl: Level of agreement, 1 to 5 scale, responding to: We need more respect for authority in Canada

var.name: e1
var.labl: How important is a post-secondary education today for a person's future economic situation?

var.labl: How important is Alberta's post-secondary education system for the province's future economic situation?

var.name: e3
var.labl: Would you like to see more or less government spending on post-secondary education in Alberta?

var.name: e4
var.labl: Would you pay higher taxes to support post-secondary education in Alberta?

catgry.labl: Yes, I would pay much higher taxes
No, I would not pay higher taxes
Yes, I would pay moderately higher taxes
Yes, I would pay slightly higher taxes

var.name: k1j
